importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date when Biden completed his course of radiation therapy for prostate cancer, marking a key milestone in his treatment journey.
This is when Biden’s personal office confirmed he had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones.
This is when Biden began a pill regimen as part of his treatment for prostate cancer, indicating an early stage of intervention.
This is when Biden underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer, showing a broader treatment approach across multiple health conditions.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from May to October 2025 represents the active phase of Biden’s cancer treatment, including diagnosis, initial therapy, radiation completion, and ongoing health management.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden has completed a full course of radiation therapy as part of his treatment for prostate cancer.
The cancer was initially diagnosed as aggressive and had spread to his bones, prompting immediate treatment.
Biden began a pill regimen earlier in the year, followed by Mohs surgery for skin cancer, indicating multiple health interventions.
He completed radiation therapy at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, where his daughter posted a video of him ringing the bell—a symbolic tradition for cancer patients.
The treatment progress has been met with public gratitude and acknowledgment, including social media posts from his family.
Biden remains active in public life, scheduled to speak in Boston and at a Nebraska Democratic Party event, demonstrating resilience despite his health challenges.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones, following an earlier diagnosis and initial treatment with a pill regimen. His daughter Ashley shared a video of him ringing the bell at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, symbolizing the completion of a treatment phase. The article also notes that Biden previously underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer, indicating a broader health management approach. Despite his illness, Biden remains active in public life, with upcoming speaking engagements in Boston and Omaha, demonstrating resilience and public engagement.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
